page.title: 03CHESHIRE WORKSHOPS. (Part 2)
page.content: (continued) big stores and are exported to Europe, Japan and U.S.A. in small quantities. Other crafts are wax plaque and statue making, some basketware and woodcarving, there is also a restaurant which is as big a business as the candle making. All the food is handmade too, it is open whenever the factory is open and closes at night only when the customers go. There are usually about 25 staff employed altogether. People come individually and as families throughout the week but by far the biggest groups of customers are coach outings, for instance of Old age Pensioners or other clubs. They quite frequently come on long trips making a day's outing of it.
